intro: Chionanthus dictyophyllus, commonly known as the woolly chionanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, white, woolly foliage that covers its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring, adding a subtle floral scent to its environment. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
